含义: The character '力' (lì) primarily means 'strength', 'power', or 'force'. It can refer to physical strength, mental effort, or the capacity to perform work.
字形: The character '力' is composed of two strokes. The first stroke is a horizontal line, and the second stroke is a vertical line that curves slightly to the right at the bottom, resembling a person flexing their arm.
读音: The pronunciation of '力' is 'lì' in Mandarin Chinese.
字源: The character '力' originated from a pictograph of a plow, symbolizing the effort and strength required to till the land. Over time, it evolved to represent general strength and power.
成语: 力不从心 (lì bù cóng xīn) - the strength is not following the heart (unable to do as one wishes)
力挽狂澜 (lì wǎn kuáng lán) - to make heroic efforts to turn the tide
全力以赴 (quán lì yǐ fù) - to go all out
力排众议 (lì pái zhòng yì) - to stand firm against all opinions
例句: 他用力推开了门。 (Tā yòng lì tuī kāi le mén.) - He pushed the door open with force.
她的努力终于得到了回报。 (Tā de nǔlì zhōngyú dédào le huíbào.) - Her efforts finally paid off.
短故事: Once, a small village was threatened by a massive flood. The villagers worked together, using all their strength to build a dam. Their collective effort, or '力', saved the village from disaster.
In ancient China, a scholar named Li Bai was known for his poetic strength. His poems were said to have the power to move mountains, symbolizing the '力' of words and creativity.
诗词: 《静夜思》 - 李白 (Jìng Yè Sī - Lǐ Bái) - '床前明月光，疑是地上霜。举头望明月，低头思故乡。' (The moonlight before my bed, I suspect it's frost on the ground. I raise my head to gaze at the moon, then lower it, thinking of home.)

《登鹳雀楼》 - 王之涣 (Dēng Guàn Què Lóu - Wáng Zhī Huàn) - '白日依山尽，黄河入海流。欲穷千里目，更上一层楼。' (The sun sets behind the mountains, the Yellow River flows into the sea. To see a thousand miles further, climb one more floor of the tower.)
